Author: ziller#6589
Content: the extra newline characters are in the source data

Author: ziller#6589
Content: one thing I would say is that your structs are nested one level deeper than the json output...

Author: ziller#6589
Content: so... you have the output from the API...

Author: ziller#6589
Content: which is an array of flavour text entries as you have it...

Author: ziller#6589
Content: but your FlavorTextEntries structure has another array...

Author: ziller#6589
Content: have a look at how the data in the json is structured...

Author: ziller#6589
Content: https://pokeapi.co

Author: ziller#6589
Content: if you put pokemon-species/132/ into the search box you can see

Author: ziller#6589
Content: each individual element of the flavor_text_entries array has an array â€œlanguageâ€ and a string â€œflavor_textâ€

Author: ziller#6589
Content: at the moment youâ€™re creating another array to store the text in... then returning that... hence the output youâ€™re seeing...

Author: ziller#6589
Content: BUT... you might still need to go one level deeper... because you maybe want to know which language youâ€™re displaying the text from!

Author: ziller#6589
Content: I also have no idea why there are specific hardcoded newline characters in the flavor text... I stripped them from mine so it would render nicely

Author: ziller#6589
Content: sorry, I struggle to get this stuff across concisely in words!
